info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Transylvania, south central Henderson and north central Greenville Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Hendersonville, or near Laurel Park, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Laurel Park, Dupont State Forest, Jones Gap State Park, Etowah, Caesars Head State Park, Valley Hill, Tuxedo and North Saluda Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
